title: Study related
content: Which sem should we start dsa

comments.body: hey, do you have one which states all subjects for 1st and 2nd sem?

Haven't got the official one but here you go: 


first yr is divided into 2 cycles

chem cycle - chem is main subject, followed by python, engineering mechanics(11th grade physics kinda), electronics(a basic course), and math-1 (differential calculus)

phy cycle - phy is main subject(quantum physics), followed by C, mechanical engineering and sciences(kinda new), electrical engineering(few of these are 12th physics repeated) and math-2 (integral calculus, probably the hardest for ppl)
a thing to note, python is in semester 1. C in semester 2
python, c, math1, math2 r the common subs

chem - molecular spectroscopy, electrochem, energy storage devices, functional materials and polymers
python - basics, functions, gui, object oriented programming
mechanics - intro to statics, force system and equilibrium, distributed forces, beams and friction
electronics - intro, semiconductor diode applications, digital electronics, communication systems and embedded systems
math 1 - partial differentiatial equations and its types, beta gamma functions


phy - intro to quantum phy, quantum phy applications, magnetism, lasers and dielectrics
electrical - dc circuits, single phase ac systems, three phase balanced ac systems, electromagnetism
mechanical - ic engines, turbines, engineering materials, casting forming and joining, machining and industrial robotic automation
C - intro to C, sorting algorithms, file handling, functions
math 2 - integral calculus, laplace transforms, probability, fourier series n fourier transforms
